    • Method Detail

      • getAffectedContentRoots

        public java.util.Collection<VirtualFile> getAffectedContentRoots()
        Specified by:
        getAffectedContentRoots in class VcsDirtyScope
        Returns:
        a set of content roots affected. The content root is considered affected if there is at least one descendant dirty file or directory which is under this content root.
        See Also:
        VcsDirtyScope.getRecursivelyDirtyDirectories(), VcsDirtyScope.getDirtyFiles(), ProjectLevelVcsManager.getVcsRootFor(FilePath)

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        project for this dirty scope

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the vcs for this dirty scope

      • getDirtyFiles

        public java.util.Set<FilePath> getDirtyFiles()
        Description copied from class: VcsDirtyScope
        Get dirty files and directories. Note if the directory is listed as dirty, all files in it are also considered dirty and they are returned by this method. Note that this method does not list files that are returned by VcsDirtyScope.getRecursivelyDirtyDirectories().
        Specified by:
        getDirtyFiles in class VcsDirtyScope
        Returns:
        the set of dirty file or directories with all directory children added.

      • getDirtyFilesNoExpand

        public java.util.Set<FilePath> getDirtyFilesNoExpand()
        Description copied from class: VcsDirtyScope
        Get dirty files and directories. This method differs from VcsDirtyScope.getDirtyFiles() that it does not adds all children to the set of the dirty files automatically. The invoker should process the children of valid directories themselves.
        Specified by:
        getDirtyFilesNoExpand in class VcsDirtyScope
        Returns:
        the set of dirty file or directories without implied directory children.

      • getRecursivelyDirtyDirectories

        public java.util.Set<FilePath> getRecursivelyDirtyDirectories()
        Description copied from class: VcsDirtyScope
        Get recursively dirty directories.
        Specified by:
        getRecursivelyDirtyDirectories in class VcsDirtyScope
        Returns:
        a directories that are recursively dirty.

      • addDirtyPathFast

        public void addDirtyPathFast(FilePath filePath,
                             boolean recursively)
        Add file path into the sets, without removing potential duplicates. See pack(), that will be called later to perform this optimization.

        Use addDirtyFile(com.intellij.openapi.vcs.FilePath) / addDirtyDirRecursively(com.intellij.openapi.vcs.FilePath) to add file path and remove duplicates.

      • pack

        public void pack()
        Remove potential duplicates from the sets.

      • addDirtyDirRecursively

        public void addDirtyDirRecursively(FilePath newcomer)
        Add dirty directory recursively. If there are already dirty entries that are descendants or ancestors for the added directory, the contained entries are dropped from scope.
        Specified by:
        addDirtyDirRecursively in class VcsModifiableDirtyScope
        Parameters:
        newcomer - a new directory to add

      • addDirtyFile

        public void addDirtyFile(FilePath newcomer)
        Add dirty file to the scope. Note that file is not added if its ancestor was added as dirty recursively or if its parent is in already in the dirty scope. Also immediate non-directory children are removed from the set of dirty files.
        Specified by:
        addDirtyFile in class VcsModifiableDirtyScope
        Parameters:
        newcomer - a file or directory added to the dirty scope.

      • iterate

        public void iterate(Processor<? super FilePath> iterator)
        Description copied from class: VcsDirtyScope
        Invoke the iterator for all files in the dirty scope. For recursively dirty directories all children are processed.
        Specified by:
        iterate in class VcsDirtyScope
        Parameters:
        iterator - an iterator to invoke

        Description copied from class: VcsDirtyScope
        Check if the path belongs to the dirty scope.
        Specified by:
        belongsTo in class VcsDirtyScope
        Parameters:

        Returns:
